intro: Wittmackia laesslei, commonly known as the pink fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink and white tubular flowers. The plant produces small, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Wittmackia laesslei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
